activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Phillip James Chears

records.addlTxt:
10:19 AM Defendant Phillip James Chears appeared by video, in custody at the Rock County Jail.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald appeared by video for Phillip James Chears.  Attorney Noah M Tylenda in court for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to amend bond.  Court denies motion to amend bond.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on August 22, 2022 at 10:15 am.

3:03 PM Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Phillip James Chears appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald appeared by video for Phillip James Chears. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendants Attorney stands mute. Court enters a not guilty plea and jury trial to be set.

9:24 AM Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Phillip James Chears appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald appeared by video for Phillip James Chears. Sworn testimony of Officer Jason Bier Janesville Police Department. Witness identifies defendant. State rests moves for bind over. Defense objects. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. State objects to bond modification. Court denies bond motion.
Arraignment scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 29, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:30 AM  Prosecuting attorney Alexander David Goulart appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Phillip James Chears appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald appeared by video for Phillip James Chears. Preliminary to be rescheduled.  Zoom  Court finds good cause to continue.  Witness unavailable.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

03:03 PM Prosecuting attorney Gerald Anthony Urbik and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Phillip James Chears appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald appeared by video for Phillip James Chears. Preliminary Hearing requested via zoom, within time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
